notes.text: An update is now available for Red Hat Ceph Storage 6.1 in the Red Hat Ecosystem Catalog
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Ceph Storage is a scalable, open, software-defined storage platform that combines the most stable version of the Ceph storage system with a Ceph management platform, deployment utilities, and support services.

These new packages include numerous enhancements, and bug fixes. Space precludes documenting all of these changes in this advisory. Users are directed to the Red Hat Ceph Storage Release Notes for information on the most significant of these changes:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_ceph_storage/6.1/html/release_notes/index
notes.title: Details

notes.text: This content is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). If you distribute this content, or a modified version of it, you must provide attribution to Red Hat Inc. and provide a link to the original.
notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Ceph Storage 6.1 security, enhancements, and bug fix update

notes.text: A flaw was found in grafana. This issue may allow a malicious user to craft a request to the API that enables them to send alert messages via the "API Alert - Test".
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: grafana: missing access control allows test alerts by underprivileged user
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: OpenShift ServiceMesh (OSSM) has switched to using upstream rhel rpms for grafana, and is no longer maintaining the servicemesh-grafana package. Hence, it is marked as affected/won'tfix.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_ceph_storage/6

For supported configurations, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/1548993

vulnerabilities.title: grafana: missing access control allows test alerts by underprivileged user

notes.text:
A flaw was found in grafana. This issue occurs when sending an API call to the /ds/query or public dashboard query endpoint that has mixed queries, such as having two or more distinct data sources in one API call. As a result, the Grafana instance will crash. Currently, the only feature that uses mixed queries within Grafana is public dashboards, but it is also possible to trigger this issue by calling the API directly.
If public dashboards are enabled, reproduction requires a public dashboard to be under a heavy load. If public dashboards are disabled, reproduction only occurs when the /ds/query endpoint with a mixed query payload is under a heavy load with a load testing script.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: grafana: data source proxy race condition
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
- In OpenShift Container Platform (OCP), Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes (RHACM), and OpenShift ServiceMesh (OSSM) the grafana components are protected by OpenShift OAuth that reduces the impact of this flaw to Moderate.
-  OpenShift ServiceMesh (OSSM) has switched to using upstream rhel rpms for grafana and is no longer maintaining the servicemesh-grafana package. Hence, it is marked as affected/won'tfix.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_ceph_storage/6

For supported configurations, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/1548993
Block mixed query requests and patch to disable mixed query concurrent calls

vulnerabilities.title: grafana: data source proxy race condition
